str2: (a) indeed, really, (b) yet, however, nevertheless. From Not Used and toi; indeed though, i.e. However.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Solid, firm, steadfast. From histemi; stiff, i.e. Solid, stable.
From a derivative of tithemi; something put down, i.e. A substruction.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
This; he, she, it.
Probably strengthened from phrasso; a signet; by implication, the stamp impressed, literally or figuratively.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And, even, also, namely.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From onoma; to name, i.e. Assign an appellation; by extension, to utter, mention, profess.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and histemi; to remove, i.e. instigate to revolt; usually to desist, desert, etc.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Injustice, unrighteousness, hurt. From adikos; injustice; morally, wrongfulness.
